bug.author: yaroslavvb
bug.description:
The training log in this run is truncated halfway. <denchmark-link:https://app.wandb.ai/yaroslavvb/nccl_multiversion/runs/xf2u0a1t/logs>https://app.wandb.ai/yaroslavvb/nccl_multiversion/runs/xf2u0a1t/logs</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.76. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Here's the code that was used to log the run above <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cybertronai/aws-network-benchmarks/blob/b89e25b098c33094faa48541e5dde17e154327d7/nccl_multiversion.py#L251>https://github.com/cybertronai/aws-network-benchmarks/blob/b89e25b098c33094faa48541e5dde17e154327d7/nccl_multiversion.py#L251</denchmark-link>
Really appreciate the bug report. I was taking a quick look at your reference code and I noticed you have your AWS keys in there - I think you probably want to take those out as the code is public.
AWS makes it really easy to leak credentials, don't they. Those are fake keys though :)
BTW, I noticed in my console logs it says " 2.86 5wandb: Program ended successfully", and this is exactly when the web logs cut off.
One possibility is that this has something to do with doing multiple runs in a row, I was doing run/crash/run/crash/run/etc , ie what triggers "wandb: Program ended successfully"?

That‚Äôs triggered when your script exits, we add an exit hook to your script that tells the wandb process how you‚Äôve exited. I thought we flush the stdout buffer, but it looks like we don‚Äôt. Can you try calling sys.stdout.flush right before your process exits? It‚Äôs also possible work is happening in threads so those need to be joined before the parent exits... <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Sat, Jun 8, 2019 at 5:58 PM Yaroslav Bulatov ***@***.***> wrote: One possibility is that this has something to do with doing multiple runs in a row, I was doing run/crash/run/crash/run/etc , ie what triggers "wandb: Program ended successfully"?
‚Äî You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#368?email_source=notifications&email_token=AAAAAEITKR5SNSFHOERYQU3PZPJLDA5CNFSM4HVZNEY2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGODXHXKDY#issuecomment-500135183>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAAAAELHIYZPMQDNQ6HBDB3PZPJLDANCNFSM4HVZNEYQ> .
We may have fixed this in the most recent release 0.8.2. If you're still seeing it would you mind making a simple script that exhibits the lost logs?
seems to be fixed for me as well
